basics.name: Kyle Chan
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the Department of Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring 2019.

work.summary: Firmware development and PCB design intern
highlights: Developing firmware in C for polloing sensor data using STM32 microcontrollers
Created data filtering and temperature control algorithms in C for dsPIC microcontrollers
Writing power logging and data conversion scripts in Python for testing sensors
Designing schematics and baord layouts for hyperspectral imaging systems
Populating PCBs using soldering irons and reflow station
Fabricating cables for subsystem interconnects and testing equipment

volunteer.summary: Oversaw and participated in the mechanical assembly and software development of an autonomous robot
highlights: Used AutoDesk Inventor to model assembly for bracket design
Designed two-layer PCB with various QFN and surface mounted components
Developed firmware in C for a STM32 microprocessor to drive DC motors with a closed-loop control system

volunteer.organization: Smart Campus Energy Lab: Weatherbox Challenge
volunteer.summary: Led team of three people to develop a low energy-self-sufficient sensor node for data collection
highlights: Developed firmware for ATMEGA chip to consolidate data from various sensors and transmit via Xbee transceivers
Designed two-layer PCB with surface mount components

volunteer.organization: Smart Campus Energy Lab: Smart Outlet
volunteer.summary: Led team of three people to develop a wireless energy-efficient outlet
highlights: Developed firmware for wireless transmission and reception of commands through Xbee transceivers
Designed two-layer PCB with surface mount components

awards.title: UH Manoa Chancellor's Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to outstanding incoming freshmen who complete a rigorous high school curriculum.

awards.title: Micromouse Champion
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2017.  See my portfolio site for more details.

awards.title: FRC World Championship: Carver Division Winners
awards.summary: My team placed 1st within the Carver division (of over 100 teams) and advanced to place 6th overall in the world.
